skill.name: analyzing-docs
skill.description: Expert at analyzing documentation quality, coverage, and completeness. Auto-invokes when evaluating documentation health, checking documentation coverage, auditing existing docs, assessing documentation quality metrics, or analyzing how well code is documented. Provides frameworks for measuring documentation effectiveness.
skill.summary: Expert at analyzing documentation quality, coverage, and completeness. Auto-invokes when evaluating ...
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with read-only tools only. No code execution, no network calls, no file writes. The Read, Glob, and Grep tools are appropriate for documentation analysis. The bash command examples shown are instructional patterns for the AI to recognize documentation formats - they are not executed.

content.value_statement: Documentation quality directly impacts team productivity and onboarding time. This skill provides systematic frameworks for measuring documentation coverage, assessing quality across multiple dimensions, and identifying critical gaps that need attention.
actual_capabilities: Calculate documentation coverage percentages across functions, classes, and modules
Assess quality across four dimensions: completeness, accuracy, clarity, and usefulness
Identify documentation gaps and prioritize fixes by severity
Generate structured analysis reports with recommendations
Support multiple programming languages including Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Go
Provide scoring frameworks for documentation quality assessment
limitations: Does not generate or modify documentation content
Does not integrate with external documentation tools or CI/CD pipelines
Cannot validate that code examples actually run without execution
Analysis is limited to code-level documentation, not external documentation sites

use_cases.title: Documentation Health Check
use_cases.description: Audit codebase documentation to identify gaps and prioritize improvements for better developer experience.

use_cases.title: Onboarding Improvement
use_cases.description: Measure documentation coverage to understand onboarding friction points for new team members.

use_cases.title: Quality Metrics Dashboard
use_cases.description: Track documentation quality trends over time and set improvement goals for the team.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Coverage Check
prompt_templates.scenario: Get a fast overview of documentation status
prompt_templates.prompt: How well is this codebase documented? Give me a quick coverage summary.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Quality Report
prompt_templates.scenario: Get comprehensive analysis with specific gaps
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the documentation quality in detail. List specific gaps and prioritize them by importance.

prompt_templates.title: Language-Specific Audit
prompt_templates.scenario: Focus on specific programming language documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze Python documentation coverage in this project. Which functions are missing docstrings?

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Roadmap
prompt_templates.scenario: Create an action plan for documentation improvement
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a prioritized action plan for improving documentation based on what I have now.

output_examples.input: Analyze the documentation coverage and quality in this project
output: Coverage by Category: Functions 68%, Classes 85%, Modules 90%
Critical Gaps: 3 public APIs undocumented, 2 functions with incorrect parameter documentation
Top Recommendations: Add docstrings to 3 public functions, Update outdated examples in user-auth.js

best_practices: Run documentation analysis at the start of sprints to track improvement over time
Combine this skill with documentation generation skills for complete workflow automation
Focus on public API documentation first since it has the highest impact on users
anti_patterns: Analyzing only new code while ignoring legacy undocumented modules
Treating documentation quality score as the only metric without reviewing actual content
Skipping error condition documentation which is critical for debugging

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes documentation patterns for Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Go. It can also work with any language using general file-level analysis.

faq.question: What is the minimum documentation coverage to aim for?
faq.answer: Industry standard is 80% or higher for public APIs. The skill provides a 70-89% rating as Good and 90-100% as Excellent.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with documentation generators like Javadoc or Sphinx?
faq.answer: No, this skill analyzes raw documentation comments in code. It does not generate or integrate with external documentation tools.

faq.question: Is my code or documentation data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only uses read-only tools to analyze files locally. No data is transmitted externally or stored elsewhere.

faq.question: Why are some bash commands shown in the skill description?
faq.answer: These are pattern examples to help the AI recognize documentation formats in different languages. They are never executed.

faq.question: How does this compare to static documentation analyzers?
faq.answer: This skill uses AI reasoning to assess quality dimensions like clarity and usefulness, not just pattern matching. It provides human-readable recommendations.
